p: For AIV surveillance in wild birds, AIV genomic analysis by next-generation sequencing (NGS) is ideal, as the mutation rate of influenza A viruses has been traditionally determined by sequencing different cDNA clones obtained from multiple plaques descending from a plaque-purified influenza A virus [ 21]. In addition, NGS has the advantage of allowing the sequencing of multiple gigabases of DNA in a single run, whereas RT-PCR amplification of each of the eight genomic RNA segments is difficult [ 22].
